class bpo.problems.ImbalancedProblem(spread=1.0)[source]Â¶

Bases: bpo.problems.Problem

A specific Problem with two resources that have different processing times for the same task. The difference between the performance of the resources is indicated by the 0 <= spread < 2.0, where a higher spread means that the performance of the resources is more different. The resource that performs better on the task is indicated by the data[âoptimal_resourceâ] of that task.

Methods:

data_sample(task_type)

Randomly samples data for the task type.

interarrival_time_sample()

Randomly samples the interarrival time of cases.

next_task_types_sample(task)

Randomly samples the task types that will be performed for the case of the specified task, when that task completes.

processing_time_sample(resource,Â task)

Randomly samples the duration of the simulation time it will take the resource to perform the task.

class bpo.problems.MMcProblem[source]Â¶

Bases: bpo.problems.Problem

A specific Problem that represents an M/M/c queue, i.e.: it has one task type, multiple resources and exponential arrival and processing times. This problem can be simulated, but it also has a method Problem.waiting_time_analytical() to compute the waiting time analytically for comparison.

class bpo.problems.Problem[source]Â¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract class that all problems must implement. An object of the class is an instance of the problem, which is equivalent to a business process case. An object has a next_case_id, which is the next case to arrive for the problem. case_id are sequential, starting at 0 for the first case to arrive, 1 for the next case to arrive, etc. An object also has a dictionary that maps case_id -> (arrival_time, initial_task), where arrival time is the simulation time at which the case will arrive and initial_task is the first Task that will be executed for the case.

Methods:

data_sample(task_type)

Randomly samples data for the task type.

from_file(filename)

Instantiates the problem by reading it from file.

from_generator(duration)

Instantiates the problem by generating cases, their tasks and the corresponding arrival times, processing times, and data at random.

interarrival_time_sample()

Randomly samples the interarrival time of cases.

next_case()

Returns the next case to arrive.

next_task_types_sample(task)

Randomly samples the task types that will be performed for the case of the specified task, when that task completes.

processing_time(task,Â resource)

Returns the time it will take the resource to perform the task.

processing_time_sample(resource,Â task)

Randomly samples the duration of the simulation time it will take the resource to perform the task.

restart()

Restarts this problem instance, i.e.: sets the next case to arrive to the first case.

save_instance(filename)

Saves the problem to file.

Attributes:

initial_task_type

An element of Problem.task_types that is the first to execute in any case.

resources

A list of identifiers (typically names) of resources.

task_types

A list of identifiers (typically labels) of task types.

classmethod from_file(filename)[source]Â¶

Instantiates the problem by reading it from file.

Parameters

filename â the name of the file from which to read the problem.

Returns

an instance of the Problem.

from_generator(duration)[source]Â¶

Instantiates the problem by generating cases, their tasks and the corresponding arrival times, processing times, and data at random. Uses the methods interarrival_time_sample, processing_time_sample, data_sample, and next_task_types_sample to randomly generate the cases and tasks. These can be implemented in specific problems to obtain the desired behavior.

Parameters

duration â the latest simulation time at which a new case should arrive.

Returns

an instance of the Problem.

abstract property initial_task_typeÂ¶

An element of Problem.task_types that is the first to execute in any case.

class bpo.problems.SequentialProblem[source]Â¶

Bases: bpo.problems.Problem

A specific Problem with two resources and two task types. Each case starts with a task of type T1. After that is completed a task of type T2 must be processed. The resources have different processing times for the tasks. The resource that performs better on a task is indicated by the data[âoptimal_resourceâ] of that task. Resource R1 performs better on task T1 and resource R2 on task T2.

Methods:

data_sample(task_type)

Randomly samples data for the task type.

interarrival_time_sample()

Randomly samples the interarrival time of cases.

next_task_types_sample(task)

Randomly samples the task types that will be performed for the case of the specified task, when that task completes.

processing_time_sample(resource,Â task)

Randomly samples the duration of the simulation time it will take the resource to perform the task.

class bpo.problems.Task(task_id, case_id, task_type, data)[source]Â¶

Bases: object

A task.

Parameters

  • task_id â the identifier of the task.

  • case_id â the identifier of the case to which the task belongs.

  • task_type â the type of the task, i.e. one of the Problem.task_types.

  • data â a dictionary with additional data that is the result of the task, each item is a label -> value pair.
